mdRecord.dcterms:title: Military Order, Brigadier General Caesar Rodney to unknown, 1777 January 21
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Rodney, Caesar, 1728-1784
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Caesar Rodney, signer of the Declaration of Independence, writes to an unknown recipient, ordering "that the Guard be strengthened with a Captain and twenty four men to be furnished from all the Troops now in town proportion to their numbers". Autograph document signed, 1 page.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Wayne Rickert Collection of Founders' Autographs
